headline: No Artists’ Lofts, Just the Chaotic Streets
abstract: The poverty and chaos of Kinshasa drive an art scene that’s vivid, unrelenting and genuinely dangerous.
lead_paragraph: Conventional wisdom holds that new movie releases of January are dogs. That’s arguably true everywhere. Except in New York art houses. For instance, this week Film Forum unveils “System K,” a lively, cogent, unsettling documentary about the incredible art world roiling in Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo.
